comments:
F3

If you add a new extension to a plug-in with a bogus class name you will get a
NullPointerException

STEPS
1) Import org.apache.lucerne as binary
2) Open the plugin.xml
3) Select the Extensions pane
4) Select the Add button under All Extensions
5) Select Extension Templates-Editor
6) Enter sdf sdf sdf as the editor name
7) NPE

I actually get the NPE regardless - even with the default values.

This is because you are trying to add an extension and new Java code into a 
binary project (that does not have any source folders). Granted that we should 
handle this gracefully, but this is not a mainstream scenario (binary projects 
should not be modified at all).

Also an issue for Hello World sample, Multi Page Editor, New File Wizard, Pop up
Menu, Preference Page, Property Page and Sample View

All these templates use the same base class that looks for a source folder to 
place newly generated classes into. This is still just one problem.

Fixed.  Code has been released in HEAD.
In the event when a user tries to add Java code to a binary project, we now 
handle it gracefully by displaying an error message indicating so.  We still 
generate however the other files (if any) and the xml for the plugin.xml.
